meanings.definition: To make or become longer in length.
meanings.sent1: She used a ruler to elongate the line on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar will elongate as it grows into a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to elongate the scarf, but it kept getting tangled.
meanings.sent4: His shadow seemed to elongate as the sun began to set.
meanings.sent5: The road seemed to elongate endlessly into the distance.

meanings.sent1: He needed to elongate the rope to reach the other side of the river.
meanings.sent2: The bridge will elongate to connect the two islands.
meanings.sent3: The joke seemed to elongate as more people joined in on the laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her patience began to elongate like a rubber band being stretched.
meanings.sent5: The train tracks seemed to elongate into the horizon.
